website_summaries.verdict: One of the best on-ear wireless headphones Sennheiser offers in its lineup.
pros: Great sound at an affordable price
The included charging station provides a convenient location to store the headphones when not in use
cons: Wireless connection has been known to drop every now and then

website_summaries.verdict: While it doesn't quite eclipse the less-expensive Bose, the Sennheiser PXC 550 Wireless headphone is comfortable and feature packed, and performs very well.
pros: The Sennheiser PXC 550 Wireless is very comfortable, relatively lightweight over-ear wireless headphone that sounds very good and features impressive noise-cancellation technology
It has touch controls and delivers excellent performance as a headset
cons: while the sound quality is excellent for Bluetooth, it's lacking that little bit of extra sparkle and definition (Sennheiser's own Momentum II Wireless sounds better)

website_summaries.verdict: The Sennheiser PXC 550 headphones deliver excellent Bluetooth audio and noise cancellation in a feature-packed—if occasionally problematic—design.
pros: Powerful, adjustable audio performance with rich bass depth and bright highs
Includes a detachable audio cable for passive listening
cons: Control pad is easy to misfire in certain modes
Possible to accidentally power the headphones up or down because of swiveling earcup controls
Digital signal processing is not for purists

customer_reviews.title: I'd originally got the Bose QC35mk2's but returned them as they were oh-so flaky when connecting to certain devices like my PC
customer_reviews.text: Got these on now as I write this review...boy are they comfy! I'd originally got the Bose QC35mk2's but returned them as they were oh-so flaky when connecting to certain devices like my PC, TV etc with constant drop-outs. These were ordered in their place, and have not had a single drop-out or problem with them whatsoever. The audio quality is absolutely top notch...and to my (non-audiophile ears) just as good as my various wired headsets....and about £100 LESS than the Bose's....
customer_reviews.author: Rex23_snapa

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Lasted just about a year 'til the warranty ran out. Worked fine until then, but suddenly they keep disconnecting and reconnecting all the time, the battery doesn't last more than a few hours, the sound button stopped working - I cant reset to factory settings, it wont clear the pairings to allow re-pairing. Absolute rubbish. Considering the price I am extremely angry. They are now going to get destroyed in an attempt to get some satisfaction from them!
customer_reviews.author: smiffy

customer_reviews.title: Noiseguard don't do his job.
customer_reviews.text: A like it a lot, but unfortunately I think I was expecting too much of the noise reduction: Human voices, dog barks, television and other sounds are VERY audible. I expected to have a feel of " isolation of the world", don't know if my sample has some issue but this does give only 4 stars. The sound is very good. If you make some changes in the 'director' mode and use an equalizer you can have the full potential of this headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Augusto Bressan Trevisol

customer_reviews.title: Volume a bit low
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these after watching reviews comparing them with similar items from Sony and Bose,and these were then reduced by 80 So I promptly ordered them, the sound is good, played around with the app and they sounded ....ok but not great,and at full volume they never give quite enough, so I returned them and thought about it and I don’t really need wireless or noise cancelling as I use headphones mostly at night when the family’s in bed and I don’t want to disturb them, so I have ordered a pair of AKG , I have high hopes for these will let you know,
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. T. Lunt

customer_reviews.title: Poor noise cancelling and disconnection problems
customer_reviews.text: I'm not having much luck with headphones. My Bose QC25's failed due to a design fault with the right ear cup and the Sony WH-1000XM3s I replaced them with suffered from buggy firmware. After two returns I gave up and went with the Sennheiser PXC 550. They were the worst of the lot. Not only was the noise cancelling ineffective even at maximum levels (it actually amplified background noise during train travel), but they repeatedly cut off during video conferencing calls. Now looking for other options.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Cresswell

customer_reviews.title: Cushion pad tears apart after a few use
customer_reviews.text: Superb sound and noice cancellation. Very good design and comfortable. But here’s how the cushion pad tears apart after a few use. There’s no way to stop this once it starts falling apart. I reported to sennheiser support. IMPORTANT EDIT: I created a service ticket to Sennheiser. They immediately sent a replacement pad free of charge in a few days via special courier!!! I would say Sennheiser is definitely the 1st choice for Headphones - you cannot get this level of customer service from another brand !!!
customer_reviews.author: Hakan

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, comfortable, long battery life, brilliant noise reduction
customer_reviews.text: Likes: Very comfortable over the ears. Noise reduction is excellent. Sound quality is excellent. There are a few built in preset configurations and, using the iPhone app, you can define your own audio settings too. Ears don’t seem to get too hot, unlike other over ear headphones I’ve owned. Battery life is excellent. I’ve been using them for 2 hours per day while commuting and have only been charging them once every fortnight. Comes supplied with a 3.5mm jack cable so you can plug directly in to devices that can’t pair to Bluetooth headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Bluntknife

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Would not connect to any of three Bluetooth devices, and when using it in wired mode I only got sound from one earpiece. The volume from this on earpiece was abysmal. One expects better at this price. No doubt this a a one off, but one reviews the product received. As ever, Amazon's return procedure was faultless.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie53

customer_reviews.title: sound is okay but not high quality, overall features are good
customer_reviews.text: The right hand earcup has a touch command which is intuitive and useful. The sound quality is only average, compared to higher quality products such as Master & Dynamic headsets. On a long flight I left this Sennheiser unit running for around 8 hours, and felt really dizzy afterwards which I never experience although I fly often. I attribute this potentially to the bluetooth waves not being all that healthy... I have switched to using a cable version instead and avoid any long-term health risks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: depth and seperation is fantastic. Now the icing on the cake
customer_reviews.text: Many years ago I bought a pair of Sennheiser yellow pad sony walkman style headphones and they blew me away. I have been listening to these now for hours with different settings and files. What a superb set of headphones. The clarity, depth and seperation is fantastic. Now the icing on the cake, these are ultra comfortable and adjustable. The best headphones I have ever had, and that is saying something.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, clear sound and great features
customer_reviews.text: I have only had them a couple of weeks so far so they're still wearing in but the sound is clear and much better than my older sennheiser px series, the bass is clear but a little overblown still so I feel they still need a bit more time until they're worn in. But in general love the design, feel, fit & features they possess. I have them on for anything from an hour upto three hours with no ear fatigue whatsoever; very comfortable and worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Mikie

customer_reviews.title: Solid 4.5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Superb sound quality really sennheiser are second to none. Fit is OK for smiler ears. Comfort is not as superb as bose but still very good. Build quality is top notch. Everything else is very nice. When I was buying headphones for me only choice was do I go with sennheiser = sound quality 5, comfort 4. Or Bose = sound quality 4, comfort 5 Before I bought sennheiser I tested them both but there can be only one. I'm very pleased with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: MilanProg

customer_reviews.title: Faulty left speaker, otherwise impressed
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I received a faulty pair so my opinion may be biased. The sound quality seemed good but the left speaker was rattling and vibrating. The noise cancelling seemed to more often amplify background sounds but again this was predominantly in the faulty left ear. The Bluetooth and touch functions worked flawlessly for the two days I was using them before returning them. If not for the faults mentioned I'd have given them 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For the office
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound quality but poor anc. I used these while commuting to work and the anc struggled with bus noise. I was also disappointed by the stability of the connection to my phone, I had many drop outs on the walk to work I take daily. If you plan on not moving around much these headphones are dor you, if you are an active user look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Go Tee Gadgets

customer_reviews.title: Wow . Comfy and stunning clarity
customer_reviews.text: Just got these and gave them a really good workout on the train. Firstly easy paired up to my iPhone XR, then downloaded the phone app easily. The comfort is just wonderful as you’d want / expect and the sound is fantastic with plenty room for changing through the app. Clarity is top drawer. Noise cancelling is very good and battery life is 30 hours full charge so no complaints with that as it’s superb amount of charge. Very happy indeed. Premium quality build all round
customer_reviews.author: AuldReekie

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bit disappointed with the Noise Cancelling feature Other reviews do say that it's not the headphones strongest point but I thought for the money they must be pretty good. I ordered them and was disappointed that they were average at best,I have a cheap pair of £50 KS Immerse headphones and these are just as good at Noise cancelling as the Sennheisers. When it comes to sound quality as you'd expect there is no comparison,these are excellent and we'll balanced all round They look very high end,seem well built and are very comfortable but the Noise cancellation was enough for me to return them
customer_reviews.author: shaky

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of headphone but.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have a great build quality and packed with features which makes them great for this price! However, my problem was that I hear a hissing sound from when ANC is on (more like a distant waterfall) even when the music is playing. The higher the volume the higher the sound. I have described the issue to Sennheiser UK support and they replied saying that the hissing sound should disappear when music is being played. They have recommended me sending them the headphones for an examination. These are my second pair of headphones which I have returned. Quite a shame because I liked their design and build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jac-991

customer_reviews.title: Hinge noises
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with these, secure fit, good quality sound and decent noise cancelling. The issue is that the hinge has started to make noises when I move my head (even when otherwise stationary) 6 months in after purchase. The headphones are in pristine condition (I also have QC35s and tend to change them up). Very disappointing as the crackling sounds from the hinge are ruining the noise cancelling and listening experience completely and rendering these not fit for purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I really expected something special from Sennheiser, but am a little disappointed with these headphones. The cup size (not a bra) doesn't know if it should be, on or over ear! A strange fit / design. That said, they are comfortable and I do like the looks. The biggest let down, however, is the noise canceling. I bought these to replace my older Sony MDR-XB950Nn1's which are the best part of £100 cheaper, and the NC is hardly any different. So for the price, I expected that little bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top-drawer!
customer_reviews.text: Being currently #3 in Sennheiser wireless hierarchy, these cans still sound amazing nearly 4 years since release. Superseded by PXC-550 Mark 2, with better chip and codec, and by Momentum 3.0 with same modern smarts, PXC-550 still very much can provide enormous enjoyment. Sound is great, first old aptX cans that have sound great to me, and not just good. Comfort is also top-notch, app is good enough and I just hope ANC is worth of business users!
customer_reviews.author: Florestan's Music

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: These are a good set of headphones, nice feature of the headphones turning on when you unfold them and touch sensitive controls on the right cup are good but can be a little annoying, as the lightest touch when adjusting how they sit will stop play, the auto-pause feature is a bit annoying as it can pause the music when a slight movement is made and it senses that the headphones have 'moved' off the ears. Sound quality is very good and microphone sensitivity is brilliant and callers can hear you clearly. Overall good headphones, solidly built and feel and worth paying a little extra for.
customer_reviews.author: SpunkyMunky

customer_reviews.title: Love them !
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are perfect. I had my eye on them for a long time and went for it. The sound is amazing and doesn't bleed to badly at mid volume. They are comfortable but be aware as per usual with over/on ears if you wear glasses they will dig in over time. Batter is really good and charges quickly and the case it comes with fits it perfectly along with all the cables. Perfect for long journeys or commutes with the adaptive noise cancelling
customer_reviews.author: Tony H

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because my old ones broke . Took them out of the box and they didn't connect to bluetooth , which is one of the reasons I bought them , so I thought I'd use wired connection , but even wired connection uses batter lying life instead of going by the supply from your phone . So even if you manage to connect your phone to bluetooth and the battery life finishes you can't use wired connection . And also if you listen when you're outside even if they're just a little bit of wind , it makes such a loud noise going past your headphones .
customer_reviews.author: David Costea

customer_reviews.title: Some of the best I've owned
customer_reviews.text: So these headphones are great, they are super comfortable even after hours of wearing them. The sound quality is great, not as good as my Audio Technica ATH-M50X, but for a wireless pair of earphones they are the best I've heard. Battery life is incredibly impressive, I charge them around once a week and use them every day at both work and the travel to and from. The only small downside is the noise cancellation, comparing it to the Sony WH-1000XM3 its not as good and does let in some more sound, but it really isn't anything to complain about. Overall, the best wireless headphones I've owned, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Worthy daily driver
customer_reviews.text: Solid, sturdy unit. Lovely materials used, and feels premium. Noise cancelling is, for me who never really had it before, amazing. The affect is eerie. I find the unit lacking punchy bass, but very rich/detailed in the mid/treble bands. A solid unit. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: silverFOX

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase overall, but prefer the cheaper Sennheiser BTNC 4.50
customer_reviews.text: The heaphones are fine - noise cancelling as expected and easy to use. There are some nice new features, like the "double-tap" to hear surrounding noise. However, I personally prefer the Sennheiser BTNC 4.50 for the following reason: 1) Noice cancelling about as good (as far as I can tell) 2) The band is thicker on the PXC 550 and therefore is causing some literal headaches for me - even when stretched to the largest size 3) Touch controls are finicky and slightly annoying Everything else is fine - seller fulfiled on time and was well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Ended up changing this review. Just to note, I have a pair of Sony Bluetooth headphones I got for £75 and they still work perfectly fine after 3-4 years. Sennheiser on the other hand? They've turned faulty after just under 6 months. All of a sudden, the quality died and whenever noise cancellation was turned on, a deafening high pitched tone comes on in the left ear. It was so loud, my left ear is still partly deaf from it. Not at all recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie M.

customer_reviews.title: By far the best headphones i had.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is very nice, especially with ANC on. I bought these pair of headphones for work, ANC by itself isn't much helping in the office, you still can hear a lot of sounds, but if you turn on some music , you will be able to work even if somebody yelling near you. These headphones are not designed for the outdoor, wind blows in the microphone and you hear a lot of noise. :) Exists some troubles with Bluetooth pairing sometimes with my Windows laptop and android smartphone. Very stylish and comfortable you will get a lot of attention.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Sound
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with the sound of these. I love my Momentum 2.0 phones so thought I’d try these for use on planes & trains. They pair easily and are reasonably simple to use but what impresses me is the sound. I was expecting the noise cancelling element to degrade the sound but these have plenty of punch & the detail is impressive. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W. Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Snap these up.  Best in class.
customer_reviews.text: This is our families second pair. Owners fall in love with them. We’ve used a lot of the competitors over time, and for me these beat Bose, and the more retro looking Momentum’s hands down. Due to ease of use, comfort, sound quality and build quality. Now they are now longer current model they are a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Headphones disconnect every 30 seconds
customer_reviews.text: I'll be walking along and the headphones will disconnect, i will have to restart the headphones to get them to connect again, it's infuriating, This started after a couple months so i cannot return it. I am severely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Vytokon

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: I think overall it's quite amazing! the noise cancelling is top notch as well as the sound quality. Only the smart pause that's sometimes off but it's a must have headphone for those seeking for amazing sound quality and noise cancelling. plus other features that the beat's audio doesn't have.
customer_reviews.author: Seymour2

customer_reviews.title: Weak
customer_reviews.text: Not suitable for my needs at all. I decided to give these ago over Xmas and was disappointed. No wonder why I never owned a pair of sennheiser headphones😏 I returned these and got myself a pair of Bose QC35 mk2 instead.
customer_reviews.author: Mr T

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought they’d be.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely surprised by these headphones. Decent price and ok sound reduction from outside noise. Great for blocking out snoring! Noise reduction is good enough for you to hear your music properly without having to have them really loud. Battery life is excellent. I think these will be great on a plane.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: problem with battery charging
customer_reviews.text: it is a brand new product. just received it. i can not get a full battery charging. why ? please advise. how do i understand that my headphones are fully charged( its battery) ? when the small white lines blink , they never stop... what is the sign that my h/phones are fully charged. waiting anxiously your advise.
customer_reviews.author: michael minas

customer_reviews.title: Top quality and full of useful features
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm very happy with these headphones. The sound quality is great and isn't affected when activating the noise cancellation. They are lightweight, without feeling cheap and are comfortable to use for long periods. The only issue I've had was people couldn't hear me on a call when out doors in strong wind, but that would have been the same without a headset.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Cheeseman

customer_reviews.title: Everything is good but it feels little heavy on my head after ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything is good but it feels little heavy on my head after few hrs of use. If you looking for comfort then go for Bose. I was using bose before and i never felt any pain, was super comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really good but...
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones I own, literally everything is great about them and I highly recommend, my only problem is that when the battery is down to around half the headphones start playing a really annoying "the battery is low, please charge headset" voice and it goes off every couple of minutes or so
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Umph, mixed feelings about this one.
customer_reviews.text: Umph, mixed feelings about this one. The sounds is great, if the machine it is coming from it is giving it enough juice. EVEN with an AMP, this will not sound louder due to its own AMP used for the ANC. Would recommend you try this in a store somewhere before making the purchase. BT sound quality is not yet where I would like it to me. Im going to stick to wired for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Marius Radu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all-rounder for music, gaming and calls.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable to wear for hours at a time, and excellent sound quality. Maximum sound level maybe too low for some but I find it perfect for both music and gaming. The Bose equivalent had better noise cancelling but no 3.5 jack, which was important. The controls are easy to operate but my only quibble is that it's easy to disconnect a call if you take touch the headset accidentally. Update 03/07/19. After 6 months use, the wired plug port has a weaken spring mean that the lead falls out. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Gavino

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Sound
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound - I have paired these to a Bluetooth adaptor called Avantree 4.0 Micro USB Adapter. With other bluetooth adapters (Blitzwolf) I was getting great coverage but It was making the headphone mic turn on which was bad for gaming / general use. With this bluetooth adapter for the PXC 550 it works perfect and I can use these with my PC no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. L. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Headband Broken! Bad design
customer_reviews.text: Owned for 3 months, carefull user, the adjustment on the headband has broken, verry annoyed after the price they cost that such an important part has broken with so little use!
customer_reviews.author: Beay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect headphones for this price
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant product. Wonderful design. High quality sound. Thanks for the opportunity to have this brand here. I recommend it to any fans who holds the sound quality and design.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Ivanov

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: So these headphones aren't that great! I mean the sound is great acoustically, it does feel rounded in the tones however it does take a bit of volume to get it right. Not good for gaming, actually better off buying a £5 headphone. Acts like you're on the phone when you use it for gaming. Bluetooth is good, touch sens for skipping, stopping and playing is kinda meh... Prefer using my phone than that. Overall kinda meh 5/10
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic and phenomenal device.
customer_reviews.text: Best sound quality and 90% liking for noise cancelling. Easy to connect and enjoying the multi device Bluetooth connectivity. Absolutely hassle free. Material over the ears are feels very soft and comfy, some time i wear it around most of the time in day(max: straight 11 hours few times) with a single issue. feels joy on ears and on head too.
customer_reviews.author: Ankur Jaiswal

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancelling pointless
customer_reviews.text: I recieved these headphones today and I have to say, I'm extremely underwhelmed with the quality of the noise cancelling. They fail to cancel out even light snoring and I can barely tell the difference between ANC off or full. This could be a faulty unit but dont want to risk returning them and missing out on the price deal.
customer_reviews.author: jordan

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth won't work anymore after using the jack
customer_reviews.text: It seems this problem has been known. When using the jack, there's a chance the bluetooth won't work anymore and you won't be able to enter pairing mode again. It seems there are two solutions, somehow manage to use captune app to reset to factory settings (but you need to be connected via bluetooth lol) or send it to the manufacturer as it is a hardware problem. If you fancy taking your chances, sound is nice and it sits comfortably on the ears. But if you're one of the unlucky ones, too bad. Price is too much for this gamble, go with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Product good. Documentation dire.
customer_reviews.text: Not had heavy use yet. Like what I've heard so far. The one thing that makes me grind my teeth is the documentation. I found the illustrations didn't illustrate for me. Probably too old. Having finally, including finding the manual on line was an electronic version of the paper one, cracked it so now it seems clearer. However surely the point of a manual is to help the uninitiated into understanding not explain what one has already grasped. Who do the authors use to check their work?
customer_reviews.author: Mary Allum

customer_reviews.title: Great sound rubbish noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: if you wanted noise cancelling headphones look somewhere else cos these don't work at all, but they are very comfortable and great sound i use them every day for at least a couple of hours and the battery lasts about 2 weeks
customer_reviews.author: Tonicviper

customer_reviews.title: Where's the volume?
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to like these but the volume even at max is just too low , I've tried the 3 main contenders and rate the Sony 1000xm2 the best . Similar quality sound but more volume and a touch more low end. The Bose were not close. Just started my return and will be getting the XM2
customer_reviews.author: Happy customer

customer_reviews.title: Recurring issue with the headphones
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought these headphones, I had to replace them after 3 weeks due to a fault in the noise cancellation. Now having the second pair of headphones less than 2 years, the same problems are occurring. 1. An unusual noise cancelling feeling of imbalance and suction 2. The headband extender has become stiff and feels like they will be broken when trying to adjust the headphones. I have been an avid fan of Sennheiser for years and have been buying headphones from Sennheiser largely because of a build quality that I can trust. However, these specific headphones have been a lot of hassle.
customer_reviews.author: phillip harper

customer_reviews.title: Novice's Opinion - my first head phones
customer_reviews.text: Bought more out of curiosity than need. Works fine but a few general observations: 1. The sound is lower than I expected. Clear but low 2. Difficult to pair with my Samsung Galaxy S8 phone - I had to use NFC 3. Comfortable to wear 4. Noise cancelling is weaker than expected - it may be that my expectations were optimistic but cancelling noise is pretty clear cut.
customer_reviews.author: Book Scout

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, but....
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product, good noise cancelling, great comfort, mind blowing battery life and most importantly, it weighs no more then my phone. My only problem being that the sound and bass were not as good as I had initially thought. But still an amazing product, I'd highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Armands

customer_reviews.title: Quality Sennheiser PXC 550 Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Impressive build quality with ability to fold down pretty compact. Battery life seems extraordinarily good. Sound quality is just really good with some nice rich tones and not too bright and tinny like so many nowadays. I’ve owned in ear and over ear heads with these simply being the best by far.
customer_reviews.author: Peter, Surrey

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser brand!
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for more than 2 years. Great sound quality, the noise cancellation as well. Sometimes i just put on the headphones, turn on the noise cancellation and joining the full of silence.
customer_reviews.author: David Cerva

customer_reviews.title: Near perfect... with a couple of exceptions
customer_reviews.text: Near perfect, only really 2 issues- the touch control isn’t always accurate, great for volume and skipping but pausing and turning on transparency isn’t great. My other issue is the way that they have to be positioned to be turned off. I didn’t think it would be an issue but it’s something to consider if you don’t store it in the case every time. Other than that they sound amazing and they never lose connection and it feels like I don’t have to charge them for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Mather

customer_reviews.title: Reliable headset for music and conferences
customer_reviews.text: Bought this device this week. One iPhone connected immediately, the other not. One phone call to Sennheiser (number was available in My Orders) and...problem solved! (btw, it’s just reseting the bluetooth by pressing 4sec Effect Mode Control button). Spotify music is 100% great, radio even better, WhatsApp ConfCalls perfect, and my interlocutors say my voice can me heard crystal clear. Highly recommended product!
customer_reviews.author: naranjayelisa

customer_reviews.title: Very good noise cancelling headphones
customer_reviews.text: Used by my son for his drumming practice - and the occasional film watching afternoon on his iPad. Very comfortable to wear, two Boise cancellation settings, with exceptionally good battery life
customer_reviews.author: John P. Vickers

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I like these headphones a lot for the wireless feature and headphone controls. I'm not sure its noise-cancelling is as good as some cheaper sets, but it's fine for the train and office environment. It's not great at eliminating voices, but neither was my previous one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Morschel

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pair of headphones. I use them for meetings and online teaching, as well as watching videos and listening to music, and they work well in all instances.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. X

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones, sound quality is superb although I gave them 4 stars based on the fact that, for me personally, they could be just a little louder. Battery life is great I charge them up once every 1 to 2 week's and use them every night after work. Noice cancelling works well from what I have experienced so far, not sure about aeroplane, train or other every day scenarios but certainly blocks out nearly all of background noise at home and out and about.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Made mostly of plastic.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound quality, the issue is the joints. They feel frail and can't handle rugged use for long. The noise cancelling is good but isn't as good as the BOSE.
customer_reviews.author: Acetyl......Joline joleene

customer_reviews.title: Overall very happy
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancelling is not the best ever but still very good. Not as isolating as some other models. Still the quality, design, weight, and controls have not left me disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: the quality is good and the sound is clear
customer_reviews.text: Much quieter than my previous ones so personally not worth the price if you want loud headphones. other than that, the quality is good and the sound is clear. Just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Luke G.

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected them to be
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to drown out my noisy neighbours. They work beautifully. Was worried about sound quality as I'm used to using a pair of Audio Technica ATH M50x, but the sennheisers perform admirably. Just give them time to burn in and dont use the built in effects. Pretty comfy too, nice and light and can wear them all day.
customer_reviews.author: JamesM

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality for music and film. I haven't used them for phone conversation yet. For anyone struggling to pair devices, make sure you hold the Bluetooth button down for the full 4 seconds. Very comfortable even with glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best end of...
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones I have ever had, I have Bose and had other good quality makes before and these are just sublime, as the title says the best end of.. .....
customer_reviews.author: R Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Don't use ANC
customer_reviews.text: While I was using the ANC, I was hearing a bad white noise. That noise badly affected my music taste. But without ANC it is ok as wireless headset.
customer_reviews.author: Mesut Keklik

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound, and unrivalled noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best headphones I’ve ever had, and I have a few! They allow you to select the level of ambient noise you hear; from street sounds for safe about town walking, to full noise cancellation so you can hear your music or film in the noise of a tube or a plane., and without the sea sickness the Bose QCs give you. Amazing sound quality, and pretty comfy too. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Clear and balanced sound
customer_reviews.text: Crystal Clear and bass where it should be. Typical Sennheiser quality. Comfortable fit and virtually instant connection. You really do get what you paid for!!
customer_reviews.author: Avengerfish3

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones with great sound and excellent noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphones with great sound and excellent noise cancelling. very comfortable and light and so easy to connect. great price and look better compared to qc35. was going to go for sony but would rather not have a headphones that is known to break. highly recommend these
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancellation is brilliant.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband as his hearing is poor and I could hear what he was listening to. These block out the noise for us both so it’s a win win situation. The battery life is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Vivien Siddell

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, great noise canceling, great build quality
customer_reviews.text: Great: All that is advertised is true and legit. Bad: - The cord jack input in the headphones is non-standard and a bit tricker to find if you loose. - Does not use type-c for charging. Not that it's that much of a problem, it's only that if you have newer tech only, you need old cable for them specifically.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Dimitrov

customer_reviews.title: Download the app, read the instructions!
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually pretty loyal to Sony, but after trying a set of these, I'm a convert. Make sure you play with director more on the equalizer, you'll be able to tailor these to you perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Dudley

customer_reviews.title: Very good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound quality. Excellent bluetooth performance for phone calls. Good noise cancelling. Touch controls elegant, but take time to master. Very comfortable headphone
customer_reviews.author: Jopto

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, good battery life, bit plasticy
customer_reviews.text: Overall these are really good for the price. The sound quality is excellent, with good functionality. You can use an app to customise the sound further. The headphone noise cancellation is good. The negative would be the build, it is good build but feels a bit plastic.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent...just that
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed...being connected to two devices at the same time does the job for me...and such a job. Well worth the money. The quality of the sound is second to none. they are very light and confy, you don't feel you wear them. Good job Senheiser
customer_reviews.author: Mircea Bocanu

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my Husband who is extremely happy with the headphones. Noise cancelling excellent a helicopter flew over very low and he could not hear it. Sound quality excellent and comfort also excellent. Great Quality and value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline

customer_reviews.title: A great gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift. Excellent all round quality. Have bought Sennheiser equipment many times and have never been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: ASF

customer_reviews.title: The battery will die after a year
customer_reviews.text: Been using them for a year. They are good headphones, regardless of the price and definitely could compete with the others IF they just sorted the battery man. Everytime I charge them within a minute the battery dies
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bass
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancellation not quite up to Bose QC35 standard, sound just as good though
customer_reviews.author: Thomas B Scott

customer_reviews.title: Only issue is that it is wayyyyyyyyyyy to easy to accidentally hangup on a phone call
customer_reviews.text: These things are epic. Only issue is that it is wayyyyyyyyyyy to easy to accidentally hangup on a phone call. One accidental touch on the side of the headphones, and you're disconnected. They should have made it a long press.
customer_reviews.author: Sandwich

customer_reviews.title: For the price a good choice.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good all round comfortable and value.. but not the best so returned
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Tinny, poor quality sound. Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality sound compared to similar priced products. Easy to pair and set up. Sound is thin and tinny, A cheaper pair of wired Grados embarrass these. I'd suggest spend a bit more on bose if sound cancelling is important in your choosing.
customer_reviews.author: Cartersaurus

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: Lived with these for several days listening to Netflix & music, home and on the street. They are just superb. Don't over-analyse. Just get yourself a pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Wood

customer_reviews.title: Solid headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great sounds with solid noise cancelling. Lasts a couple days of moderate use. The build quality it light with a design that grows on you over time. One down side is the occasional creaking of the joints when moving around, though they stay on your head firmly without getting uncomfortable over time
customer_reviews.author: Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Deserves a better review. 5 Stars for sound quality but does ...
customer_reviews.text: Deserves a better review. 5 Stars for sound quality but does a set of headphones need a 44 page manual?
customer_reviews.author: Robertn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasts days and charges in an instant, sound quality is unreal and I can't turn back now. Noise cancelation is perfect as well no more will I have to deal with crying babies on an aeroplane or bus.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product - it is the superseded model but is an excellent product at a competitive price.
customer_reviews.author: E. King

customer_reviews.title: Its very very good. Very.
customer_reviews.text: This is in another ball game. I used to have a cheaper model from the same brand. This is something else., Excellent noise isolation, excellent quality of sound. Tremendous features and ease of use. And very confortable to use. Not sure how could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality good, noise cancelling not so much.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality was good but the noise cancelling was fairly useless. They were not as comfortable as the rivals either. Ended up Returning them and bought the Bose qc35 II. If NC isn't important to you then they might be worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Christian

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of headphones
customer_reviews.text: Very decent pair of headphones. Nice ANC good sound - worth buying especially on sale (I got them for ~£225.) There’s just a few things that need to be ironed out - poor app and broken battery idicator on iOS (battery charge doesn’t appear correctly in iOS widget.) But overall they’re great.
customer_reviews.author: Maciej W.

customer_reviews.title: Design fault
customer_reviews.text: Broke within a month. Still awaiting amazon to get back to me and sort it. Three months later
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Hussain Gambles

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Give them time to loosen up. Get to know the settings. Neutral tone
customer_reviews.author: R M

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser PXC 550
customer_reviews.text: I found this headphone very good. The sound is great and very confortable.
customer_reviews.author: Serespo

customer_reviews.title: They are good, with issues
customer_reviews.text: Currently I've support ticket open with Sennheiser, but mine just randomly turn off if I move my head slightly sat on a train. For all the good they do (they sound good and feel good) and that I purchased in OCT 2019 and its now APR 2020. I cant recommend ATM.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought both these and the Sony MX3 and the sound quality on the Sennheiser are just fantastic. Crystal clear with a perfect amount of bass. That was main main concern (that the Senn's wouldn't have enough bass) but the sound blows the Sony's away in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: matthew summerfield

customer_reviews.title: The headphone Performance to price is not satisfying
customer_reviews.text: For that amount of money, I am not satisfied. I use Marshall Mid set for over 3 years now, that were 2 times cheeper and still performing better on both cable and Bluetooth. There is more flaws to it but this are details that won't matter that much to others customers
customer_reviews.author: Markizano

customer_reviews.text: I would have liked for the volume to be slightly higher.. But everything else are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Marius Cirstea

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Really good product, I like the head cups hugging the ears, it’s nice... thought I should pay more for a better product. For price good. Looks much better than the QC 35
customer_reviews.author: Chandima rodrigo

product_meta.title: Sennheiser PXC 550 Wireless – NoiseGard Adaptive Noise Cancelling, Bluetooth Headphone with Touch Sensitive Control and 30-Hour Battery Life
product_meta.description: Style:Old ModelSennheiser’s premium headset tailored specifically for the discerning business traveller. This stylish, compact and foldable headset delivers exceptional sound quality, class leading adaptive noise cancellation and crystal clear speech clarity. Ergonomically engineered for wearing comfort and intuitive control, this headset upgrades the on the go audio experience. In an often frantic and stressful traveller’s world, the PXC 550 Wireless puts the listener in control of their sensory environment it’s what we call 'upgrading to First Class. Troubleshoot headphones do not attenuate the ambient noise even though noisegard is active, ensure that ear pads are securely hooked to all corners of the ear cups. Ear coupling Circumaural. Pick-up pattern - 3-Mic Beamforming Array.
feature_bullets: Bluetooth 4.2 wireless technology in an ergonomically designed lightweight, comfortable and collapsible travel headset perfect for travel. Connectivity Technology: Wireless
NoiseGard adaptive noise cancellation ensures superior sound quality in every environment. Impedance:Active 490 Ohm/ Passive 46 Ohm
Intuitive user control and convenience thanks for voice prompts, touch controls, NFC pairing, smart pause and automatic on/off
Triple microphone array delivers business class communications with exceptional vocal clarity. Sennheiser sound signature quality with selective sound modes to enhance the listening experience
The PXC 550 wireless is fully compatible with CapTune, sennheiser's premium quality music player and powerful sound tuning app to perfectly adjust the feel of your music to your personal preference

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars4,057 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
